meanings.definition: The act or process of umpiring a game or match.
meanings.sent1: During the umpirages, the referee made sure the players followed the rules.
meanings.sent2: The umpirages for the baseball game were conducted fairly and efficiently.
meanings.sent3: In a world where animals played sports, the umpirages were done by wise owls.
meanings.sent4: The umpirages of life can sometimes be unpredictable, just like the weather.
meanings.sent5: Her passion for umpirages shone through as she confidently made the calls on the field.

meanings.definition: The authority or power of an umpire.
meanings.sent1: The umpirages of the referee were respected by all the players.
meanings.sent2: With great umpirages, the official maintained order on the field.
meanings.sent3: The cat claimed to have the umpirages over who got to sit on the sunny spot.
meanings.sent4: His presence exuded umpirages, commanding attention from everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The umpirages of the judge were final and not to be questioned.

meanings.definition: The decisions or rulings made by an umpire.
meanings.sent1: The umpirages of the referee determined the outcome of the game.
meanings.sent2: Players accepted the umpirages without protest, knowing they were fair.
meanings.sent3: The umpirages of the squirrel referee led to some nutty calls on the field.
meanings.sent4: Her umpirages were as sharp as a sword, cutting through any doubts or disputes.
meanings.sent5: The umpirages of the official were clear and decisive, leaving no room for confusion.
